model.interfaces.populationModel

Interface IPopulation

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Population

    public interface IPopulation
    Interface for all population models.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getPeople

        java.lang.Iterable<IPerson> getPeople()
        Allows iteration over the people in the population. The order is determined by the underlying population implementation. The unique identifiers of people are allocated in temporal order.
        Returns:
        an iterable sequence of people

      • getPartnerships

        java.lang.Iterable<IPartnership> getPartnerships()
        Allows iteration over the partnerships in the population. The order is determined by the underlying population implementation.
        Returns:
        an iterable sequence of partnerships

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • setDescription

        void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets a description for the population, which may be useful for testing and debugging.
        Parameters:

      • setConsistentAcrossIterations

        void setConsistentAcrossIterations(boolean consistent_across_iterations)
        Sets a flag controlling whether person attributes are consistent across iterations.

        If set to true, person objects will be cached, which may be problematic for scalability in implementations where the population is initially generated using a compact person representation that is expanded on the fly during iteration.

        If set to false, attributes such as name and occupation may differ when a person with a given id is retrieved multiple times.

        Parameters:
        consistent_across_iterations - true if person attributes should remain consistent across iterations
